result.execSummary:
The defendant Dywane Neal Beaver was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. On one or more other charges, Dywane Neal Beaver was found not guilty. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Dywane Neal Beaver is presumed innocent of the not guilty charges.

  • Dywane Neal Beaver was found guilty of Resisting or Obstructing an Officer [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made,  a factual basis & def guilty. 
COURT ORDERS: 14CF919 Ct. 1- 1 year jail. Jail may be with huber release for work or EMP if meets jail criteria. Deft has 45 days to report to jail. Consecutive to 16CF639 Ct. 1 & 16CF418 Ct. 1
COURT ORDERS: 14CF919 Ct. 2- w/hold sentencing. 1 year probation. Consecutive to 3 years jail. CONDITIONS: Complete any assessment, treatment, or counseling deemed necessary by agent. Comply with sex offender registry.
COURT ORDERS: 16CF418 Ct. 1- 1 year jail. Jail may be with huber release for work or EMP if meets jail criteria. Deft has 45 days to report to jail. Consecutive to 16CF639 Ct. 1
COURT ORDERS: 16CF639 Ct. 1- 1 year jail. Jail may be with huber release for work or EMP if meets jail criteria. Deft has 45 days to report to jail. Consecutive to 16CF418 Ct. 1
COURT grants 600 days jail credit granted towards 3 years jail.

COURT ORDERS: $2500 cash bond returned to poster.

Case Called: 8:56 a.m.
INCLUDES: 14CF443, 14CF919, 16CF418, 14CF925, 16CF639
State appears by ADA Ralph Uttke; Deft appears in person with Atty John Bachman.

***JURY TRIAL- Day 2 of 2***

ADA Uttke notes oral MIL re: Deft's testimony;
Atty Bachman makes statement.
COURT grants State's Request.
COURT questions Deft re: right to testify; Deft wishes to testify.
COURT questions Atty Bachman re: Deft's right to testify;
COURT finds Deft is freely, voluntarily, and knowingly willing to testify and waiving right to remain silent.

9:02 a.m. Jury enters Courtroom.
9:04 a.m. Sarah Ganski RN, Aspirus Wausau Hospital, sworn & testify.
9:17 a.m. ADA Uttke notes Stipulations to Jury.
9:17 a.m. State Rests.
9:18 a.m. Deft, Dywane Beaver, sworn & testifies.

10:23 a.m. COURT recesses for 15 min morning break.

OTR: 10:25 a.m.
BOTR: 10:42 a.m.

10:43 a.m. Jurors enters Courtroom.
10:44 a.m. K.B. sworn & testifies.
11:07 a.m. Defense Rests.
11:08 a.m. COURT recites Jury Instructions to Jury.
11:27 a.m. Closing Argument by State.
11:51 a.m. Closing Argument by Defense.
11:59 a.m. Rebuttal Closing Argument by State.

12:08 p.m. Bailiffs sworn.
12:10 p.m. Alternate Juror picked- Juror #71.
12:13 p.m. Jury exits Courtroom to Deliberate.

Discussion between Counsel and Court re: Jury Instructions read to Jury by COURT.

12:16 p.m. COURT recesses.
BOTR: 12:46 p.m.

COURT note Jury is not present in Courtroom.
COURT addresses Counsel re: information provided to Court at recess.
Counsel provided a copy of the information; COURT recites information provided to Court.
ADA Uttke makes statement re: information.
Atty Bachman responds to Information provided to Court.
Atty Bachman requests mistrial.
COURT makes findings; COURT denies Atty Bachman's request for mistrial.
12:56 p.m. COURT reads question #1 from Jury on the record.

OTR: 1:01 p.m.
BOTR: 1:50 p.m.

1:50 p.m. COURT reads question #2 from Jury on the record.
COURT and Counsel have discussion re: exhibits to Jury Room.

OTR: 1:54 p.m.
BOTR: 2:23 p.m.

2:23 p.m. COURT reconvenes.
2:24 p.m. Jury enter the Courtroom with Verdict.
2:25 p.m. COURT reads the Verdict aloud:
Ct. 1 (2nd Degree Sexual Assault/Unconscious Victim)>> NOT GUILTY
Ct. 2 (Obstructing and Officer)>> GUILTY
2:28 p.m. COURT polls Jury.
2:29 p.m. COURT releases Jury.
2:30 p.m. COURT receives verdict on Ct. 2 and enters Judgment of Conviction.
2:30 p.m. COURT receives verdict on Ct. 1.

Atty Bachman requests to proceed with sentencing.
ADA Uttke makes statement re: sentence credit.
COURT makes findings;
ADA Uttke requests recess.

Adj: 2:34 p.m.

** DAY TWO OF JURY TRIAL **
Clerk: Kimberly
Case called: 8:55am
State appears by ADA Ralph Uttke; Defendant appears in person, in custody, with Atty John Bachman

State does have rebuttal witnesses for trial today and will be introducing different police report from MCJ booking date in October 2014; Atty Bachman objects to state introducing booking report from October 2014 at MCJ; COURT will allow questions being asked regarding relationship between defendant and defense's witness and amount of money defendant had on person. COURT addresses jury instruction 1213 for "unconscious" definition and both parties stipulate to definition. 9:05am- Jury enters courtroom. 9:07am- K.B. is sworn and testifies; 9:25am- sidebar with counsel; 9:28am- R.F. is sworn and testifies; 9:30am- Defense rests. 9:31am- State calls rebuttal witnesses. 9:32am- Officer Kevin Cornell with Wausau Police Dept sworn and testifies; 9:41am- Officer Sandra LaDu-Ives sworn and testifies; 9:57am- Deputy Steven DeNovi with Marathon County Sheriff's Dept is sworn and testifies- identifies defendant. 9:59am- State rests. 10:00am- Jury exits courtroom. OTR: 10:01am for break; BOTR: 10:19am; 10:20am- Jury enters courtroom; 10:21am-The Court reads jury instructions to the Jury. 10:39am-State makes Closing Arguments. 11:07am-Atty Bachman makes Closing Arguments; 11:15am-State makes Rebuttal Closing Arguments. 11:19am-The Court instructs the Jury. 11:22am-Bailiffs sworn. 11:23am-Court Clerk picks #22 Juror out of drum. 11:26am-Jury exits courtroom to deliberate. 11:55am- BOTR for jury question regarding seeing exhibits. Counsel stipulates to having those exhibits sent back to jury to view. COURT gives exhibits 1,2,4,5,6 to jury. OTR: 11:57am BOTR: 2:20pm All parties are present except jury; COURT addresses concerns with counsel regarding jurors possibly using electronic devices to research information. OTR: 2:24pm BOTR: 2:34pm Counsel would like to bring foreperson into courtroom to ask questions regarding 1) if anyone used a cellphone 2) if anyone did research on their cellphone. 2:36pm- Jury foreperson is brought into courtroom. COURT questions foreperson regarding use of cellphone and if anyone in jury used cellphone to research this case. Foreperson stated yes jury did have cell phone in jury room and NO they did not research this case on cellphone. COURT questions foreperson regarding if cellphone was used to look up information during jury deliberation. Foreperson says "yes". 2:38pm- Jury foreperson is excused from courtroom. BOTR: 2:41pm- Counsel has specific question regarding what type of information was researched on cell phone. 2:42pm- Jury foreperson enters courtroom. 2:43pm- COURT questions foreperson regarding the type of information was researched on jury cellphone. Foreperson states what they researched was state of Wisconsin's legal alcohol limit and answer was found. 2:46pm- Jury foreperson exits courtroom. 2:47pm- COURT addresses with counsel questions jury reasearched on their cell phones while in deliberation. Parties stipulate to motion for MISTRIAL. COURT does believe actions taken by jury lead to grounds of mistrial. 2:53pm- Jury enters courtroom. COURT instructs jury panel due to events that occurred with using electronic devices that this will lead to MISTRIAL and verdict will not be read. 2:54pm- Jury panel is excused from courtroom. Parties will reset matter for another jury trial with Br. 1 JA 2:58pm- COURT ORDERS: VERDICT FORM TO BE SEALED
Adjourned: 2:59pm

**DAY ONE OF JURY TRIAL **
Clerk: Kimberly
Called: 9:05am
State appears by Atty Ralph Uttke; Defendant appears in person, in custody, with Atty John Bachman.

9:06am-Jury Panel is present. 9:10am-Jury Panel sworn. 9:11am-Counsel introduce themselves. 9:14am-Voir Dire by the Court. 9:24am-Voir Dire by the State 9:40am-Voir Dire by Atty Bachman. 9:49am-Parties make their strikes. 10:01am-Clerk reads Jurors selected. Court thanks & excuses those not selected. 10:04am-Selected Jury Panel sworn. 10:05am-Court reads Preliminary Jury Instructions. Court instructs Jury. 10:16am-Jury exits to make phone calls. OTR: 10:17am BOTR: 10:34am & Jury enters courtroom. 10:36am-State makes opening statement. 10:43am- Atty Bachman makes opening statement. 10:47am-V.J.E. is sworn and testifies- identifies defendant. 11:00am- Sidebar with counsel 11:01am- Jury exits courtroom. Counsel addresses sidebar on record. COURT prior ruling stands; defense denied. COURT prohibits questions regarding rape shield law. 11:08am- Jury enters courtroom. V.J.E. continues testimony. 11:17am- H.H. is sworn and testifies- identifies defendant. 11:27am- COURT gives jury caution regarding recess for lunch break. 11:28am- Jury exits courtroom for lunch recess. OTR for lunch recess: 11:31am.  BOTR: 12:55pm from lunch recess - Clerk Brenda.  12:56 Jury enters courtroom.  12:57pm-Officer Kevin Cornell with Wausau Police Dept is sworn and testifies - identifies defendant.  1:24pm- Jury exits coutroom. 1:25pm- OTR: Clerk: Kimberly BOTR: 1:44pm. Parties stipulate that victim- V.J.E. did have BAC of 0.17 taken after 7:00am morning of 05/25/14 at Aspirus Wausau Hospital. Parties stipulate that defendant did have sexual intercouse with victim. State will read both stipulations to jury. 1:47pm- Jury enters courtroom. 1:49pm- S.S. is sworn and testifies- identifies defendant. 2:08pm- S.G. is sworn and testifies 2:19pm- Counsel presents 2 previous stipulations to jury. COURT receives both stipulations. 2:19pm- State rests. 2:20pm- Jury exits courtroom. COURT denies Atty Bachman's motion. OTR: 2:24pm BOTR: 2:46pm Atty Bachman states defendant will testify. COURT conducts colloquy with defendant & Atty Bachman regarding defendant testifying. Defendant DOES wish to testify. 2:51pm- Jury enters courtroom. 2:52pm- Defendant is sworn and testifies. 3:55pm- Jury exits courtroom. 3:56pm- Atty Bachman will try to contact investigator and defenses witnesses again. OTR: 3:58pm BOTR: 4:15pm-Atty Bachman is not able get a hold of subpeona witnesses to appear a day earlier. 4:18pm-Jury enters courtroom. COURT instructs jury that trial will be off tomorrow (Wed. 04/19/17) and will resume on Thursday 4/20/17 at 9:00am. 4:21pm- Jury exits for day. 4:24pm- Adjourned for day
